LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.HaulMapChunks: Designate chunks on the map for hauling
If there are any relevant chunks present on the map that are not already in storage, mark them for hauling to satisfy a configured threshold.
LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.HaulMinedChunk: Should mining jobs that result in chunks (e.g. mining for stone) automatically mark the resulting chunks for hauling? This setting will only apply to mining jobs that the colony manager is tracking (though note that an originally manually designated mining job can be "taken over" by a manager if it can help satisfy a configured threshold) where the threshold is configured to make use of that type of chunk.
LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.DeconstructBui: Should unclaimed buildings be deconstructed for salvage?
LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.MineThickRoofs: Managers will designate mining in locations that have thick roofs
LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.CheckRoofSuppo: Managers will leave support columns up at regular intervals.\n\nNOTE: The position of columns is pre-calculated, cave-ins and roof collapse can still occur!
Check explicitly for safe roof supports

Instead of relying on a pre-calculated grid of roof supports, managers will calculate where roof support should go before designating mining and deconstruction tasks, which drastically reduces the risk of cave-ins and roof collapse.
Disabled because checking for roof support is disabled.
LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.CheckRoomDivis: Managers will try to prevent breaching walls that divide rooms, or that would create shortcuts.
LanguageData.ColonyManagerRedux.Mining.SyncFilterAndA: Enabling this will try to synchronize the counted materials in the threshold filter with the resources and buildings allowed for mining/deconstruction, and vice versa. Note that because a lot of building parts can be built out of every resource, enabling 'walls,' e.g., will enable every resource that can be used to build walls.
